slidePuzzle

Interface Game


  • public interface Game
    Game represents a sliding tile game. The object of the game is for a user to help a dog walker get to the dog by performing operations on the sliding tiles. This class constructs the game board, places the dog and dog walker on the board, and prints the board to the console. The game board is constructed from a quadtree (referred to as a tile). This class holds the root tile and uses the root to find the parent of a tile in one of its methods.
    Author:
    Hindes, Kelley, Pohl, Weiss

      void wipeDisplay()

    • Method Detail

      • createTree

        Tile createTree()
        Creates a quadtree with Internal and Leaf Tiles based on values for the maximum and minimum tile depth. The quadtree is created with a randomized number of splits on the leaf tiles.
        Returns:
        root of quadtree

      • placeDog

        Tile placeDog(Tile root)
        Randomly places the dog in a tile
        Parameters:
        root - of quadtree
        Returns:
        the tile in which the dog was placed

      • placeWalker

        Tile placeWalker(slidePuzzle.InternalTile root)
        Randomly places the walker in a tile
        Parameters:
        root - of quadtree
        Returns:
        the tile in which the walker was placed

      • updateDisplay

        void updateDisplay(slidePuzzle.LeafTile leaf)
        Updates display based on depth and starting points of leaf
        Parameters:
        leaf -

      • populateDis

        void populateDis()
        Helper method for console printing

      • printBoard

        void printBoard()
        Traverses the tree and prints the game board

      • wipeDisplay

        void wipeDisplay()
        Clears display on console.

      • traverseTree

        void traverseTree(Tile tile)
        Recursively calls updateDisplay on all children leaf tiles of the input param tile.
        Parameters:
        tile - - the tile to be traversed

      • findParent

        slidePuzzle.InternalTile findParent(Tile toFind,
                                    Tile startingTile)
        Finds the parent tile of any tile
        Parameters:
        toFind - the tile of which to find the parent
        startingTile - either the root or some tile above toFind in quadtree hierarchy
        Returns:
        InternalTile the parent
